# About
Dr. Kendra M Wu is an engineer and a theoretical epidemiologist. She is getting started at [University of Oxford](http://www.ox.ac.uk) as a Postdoctoral Researcher in Statistical/ Mathematical Modelling of Infectious Diseases at the [Centre for Tropical Medicine and Global Health](https://www.tropicalmedicine.ox.ac.uk) of [Nuffield Department of Clinical Medicine](https://www.ndm.ox.ac.uk), where she works on mathematical analysis of infectious disease outbreaks in low and middle income countries (LMICs). Recently, her focus has been on Ebola Virus Disease (EVD).

# Research Interests
* Infectious disease epidemiology and control
* Outbreak analysis and response
* Emerging infections
* Disease transmission dynamics
* Mathematical modelling
* Evolution of pathogens
